qas.question: What does Article IV, Section three of the US Constitution outline?
Article IV, Section Three of th United States Constitution gives Congress the power to do what?

answers.text: the power to admit new states to the union

qas.question: What does the states' requirement to give "full faith and credit" help recognize?

answers.text: legal contracts, marriages, and criminal judgments

qas.question: What are all states guaranteed by the federal government?

answers.text: guarantee to every state in this union a republican form of government

qas.question: What part of the US Constitution outlines the relationship among the states?
Article IV, Section Three allows Congress to do what?

answers.text: admit new states to the union

qas.question: What does the concept of "full faith and credit" protect?

answers.text: the recognition of legal contracts, marriages, and criminal judgments

qas.question: What is guaranteed to the states by the federal government?
What does article V, Section three of the US Constitution outline?

plausible_answers.text: the power to admit new states to the union

qas.question: What does Article V, Section Three of the United States Constitution give Congress the power to do?

plausible_answers.text: legal contracts, marriages, and criminal judgments

qas.question: What does the states' requirement to give "full government guarantee" help recognize?
What are all states guaranteed by the republican form?

plausible_answers.text: guarantee to every state in this union a republican form of government

qas.question: What does Article V, Section 4 guarantee?

context: Under <a5_0>Article IV, Section Three<a5_0/> of the United States Constitution, which outlines <a0_0><b9_0>the relationship among the states<b9_0/><a0_0/>, Congress has <a1_0><b10_0>the power to <a6_0>admit new states to the union<b10_0/><a6_0/><a1_0/>. The states are required to give "full faith and credit" to the acts of each other's legislatures and courts, which is generally held to include <a7_0>the recognition of <a2_0><b11_0>legal contracts, marriages, and criminal judgments<b11_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>. The states are guaranteed <a3_0><a8_0><b12_0>military and civil defense<b12_0/><a8_0/><a3_0/> by the federal government, which is also obliged by Article IV, Section Four, to "<a4_0><b13_0>guarantee to every state in this union a republican form of government<b13_0/><a4_0/>".
